\u0c32\u0c15\u0c4d\u0c37\u0c23\u0c3e\u0c: Small, dark and oval lesions with grey centers appear on leaves and stem. On these lesions black and raised dots develop.
\u0c1f\u0c4d\u0c30\u0c3f\u0c17\u0c4d\u0c: High temperatures and high humidity favor the disease. The fungus is spread by wind and rain. It survives in crop residues and on alternative hosts like weeds. Yield losses are mostly small.
\u0c1c\u0c40\u0c35 \u0c28\u0c3f\u0c2f\u0: There is no alternative treatment for this disease. Implement preventive measures to reduce the risk of infection in subsequent growing seasons.
\u0c30\u0c38\u0c3e\u0c2f\u0c28 \u0c28\u0: No chemical treatment is needed for this disease. Implement preventive measures to reduce the risk of infection in subsequent growing seasons.
\u0c28\u0c3f\u0c35\u0c3e\u0c30\u0c23\u0c: Plant more resilient varieties.,Control weeds.,Implement crop rotation.,Maintain good field hygiene - remove or burn any plant residues.
